author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
With a word of praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Peoples Democratic Party president Mehbooba Mufti said on Sunday that peace still topped her agenda for Jammu and Kashmir.

Addressing party workers at Khanabal in Anantnag district, she said: “I do not want the post of Chief Minister for development but also to ensure peace in the State. We joined hands [with the BJP] for the welfare of the people. That was our challenge, and will remain so.” She expressed concern over the leadership crisis in the State. “Everyone wants to grab the seat of power. It’s the cause for the Kashmiris’ suffering,” she said.

Praising her father Mufti Muhammad Sayeed, who died on January 7, she said: “My father didn’t know in which class we were studying just because he wanted to make sure every child of Kashmir went to school… He knew that the Kashmiris had suffered a lot and were not unfaithful, but were victims.”

Lauds PM’s Pak. visit

She lauded PM Narendra Modi for his visit to Pakistan. “The former Prime Minister, Manmohan Singh, was unable to do it in his two terms and couldn’t visit his birthplace,” she said.

“My father told me he wished it because peace in Kashmir was possible only when India and Pakistan came together,” she said.
title: Peace still tops our agenda: Mehbooba
